answers.answer: I had low vit D, took replacement for over a year and never noticed a difference. Same with testosterone. Recently, I went on strictly no gluten diet high in tryptophane (humus, etc), and started mega doses of Vit B complex and a sudden improvement. It feels like I'm taking a powerful antidepressant.BTW, I have been taking high doses of C for gout for a few years too. Not sure what helped, it could be a combination of things.IMHO, Vit D itself is much overrated, or one has to approach all vitamins together and not just D.

question: Hey everyone here is my storyI have been living in the UK for the past 15 years.  I am original from sunny north east China( never rains)One year after I moved here I start feeling tired and symptoms getting worse by the year. I went to the gp many times, I had tests for diabetes stds, blood protein test see if I might have cancer, Brian scan. Doctor can never find anything wrong with me, at the end the doctor say im depressed!!!Two month ago I cough a really bad cold and my new gp suggested me do a blood test for vitamins and result came back my vitamin d was 17,  normal range is 50-100.  Now I have been taking vitamins d 3 5000 iu for nearly 2 month. I also had a week long holiday but still im not feeling any better.My symptoms are, dizziness brian fog, feel like there is not enough blood in my brain sometimes very difficult to think clear, tiredness and feel like out of breath.Mu eye signed are very bad but eye tests shows I have a perfect signIm so tired right now I dont even have energy to buy a house ( my mom offers), I dress like a homeless women everyday ( jeans and trainers) a shallow of my former self,  my boyfriend keeps compaining that I dont wear heels anymore,  I get really dizzy when im on heels.Would I ever feel better??? :(  and when would I feel better?  Its so depressing as im in bed all the time, I want to have a life just  like everyone else!
title: Vitamin D deficiency would I ever feel better? ??
